meanings.definition: To have no connection or relation
meanings.sent1: The two stories are disrelated and do not share any characters or plot points.
meanings.sent2: She disrelated the events of the day to her friend, emphasizing their lack of connection.
meanings.sent3: The cat and the umbrella were disrelated in the strange dream she had last night.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts and emotions seemed disrelated, like pieces of a puzzle from different sets.
meanings.sent5: The disrelated nature of the two paintings made it hard to believe they were created by the same artist.

meanings.sent1: The disrelated books on the shelf had no common theme or genre.
meanings.sent2: His disrelated comments during the meeting confused everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The disrelated colors of her outfit clashed in a surprisingly fashionable way.
meanings.sent4: The disrelated branches of the tree intertwined in a beautiful, chaotic pattern.
meanings.sent5: The disrelated shapes in the abstract painting seemed to dance independently on the canvas.

meanings.sent1: The new evidence disrelated the suspect from the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: He disrelated his current project from his previous work to avoid any confusion.
meanings.sent3: The disrelated topics in the conversation jumped from cats to space travel in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her mind disrelated the images she saw, creating a surreal and disjointed dream.
meanings.sent5: The disrelated melodies in the song clashed in a strangely harmonious way.
